title: Mastodon Continues to Lose Users

last_post.content:
More strange Mastodon reporting. This time from @thurrott, who claims "I’ve been using Mastodon since December, but the interaction there is almost non-existent compared to Twitter."

Dude, you follow 22 people. Try following more people. The "non-existent" interaction is *up to you*.

I've found WAY MORE interactions and engagement here than I ever had on Twitter. Plus fewer death threats.

https://www.thurrott.com/cloud/social/279094/mastodon-continues-to-lose-users

title: Tootfinder

last_post.content:
If you've been waiting for full-text #search on #Mastodon, please go to #TootFinder and sign in. The more the merrier.
https://www.tootfinder.ch/

Thanks to @buercher for building it.

It's opt-in, not opt-out. It respects Mastodon culture and doesn't index accounts that don't sign in.

That means the index might be small if we don't spread the word.

#mastotips#feditips

title: Nintendo Will Pay Its Workers 10% More

last_post.content:
Nintendo’s CEO recently said “If we reduce the number of employees for better short-term financial results, employee morale will decrease” and is instead doing the opposite by raising pay to address inflation.

Some leaders are built different.

https://www.gamespot.com/articles/nintendo-will-pay-its-workers-10-more/1100-6511268/

title: MotherDuck: Big Data is Dead

last_post.content: This is an amazing and excellent must-read for anyone in analytics. The amount of analysis you can do on a single box has grown and grown while the amount of analysis organizations really get value from has stayed more or less constant. There are still some workloads that need specialty OLAP systems, but most organizations don't have them and, more important, won't EVER have them. https://motherduck.com/blog/big-data-is-dead/

title: https://pruvisto.org/debirdify

last_post.content:
Are you trying to find your contacts from Twitter on Mastodon?

There are online tools which can help with this, however Twitter is apparently going to shut them down by Thursday 9th February.

If you want to use these, now would seem to be your last chance:

🐦 Debirdify
https://pruvisto.org/debirdify

🔍 Fedifinder
https://fedifinder.glitch.me

A third tool, Movetodon, has already been shut down by Twitter.

#Twitter #Mastodon

title: Open aanpak voor Open Science | NWO

last_post.content:
Work update: I will be leaving the @utrechtuniversity.

As of April 1st, I will start as programme leader Open Scholarly Communication as part of the National Initiative Open Science.

Together with all Dutch knowledge institutions, we aim to make open science the norm in the years to come.

I am honored and proud to be able to contribute to this in the coming years.

More about the RO OS: https://www.nwo.nl/nieuws/open-aanpak-voor-open-science

title: GitHub - samim23/polymath: Convert any music library into a music production sample-library with ML

last_post.content:
Wow! @jesse just hipped me to this amazing bit of #demix/#remix #AI #ML #music #python tech called Polymath.

"The tool automatically separates songs into stems (beats, bass, etc.), quantizes them to the same tempo and beat-grid (e.g. 120bpm) and analyzes musical structure, key (e.g C4, E3, etc.) and other infos (timbre, loudness, etc.). The result is a searchable sample library that streamlines the workflow for music producers, DJs, and ML audio developers."

https://github.com/samim23/polymath

Warum es kompliziert ist mit Interface-Design, UX und der Forschung erklärt Jonas Müller-Laackman im neuen de.hypo-Blog ➡ DH3 👇

title: Inside a Florida liberal arts college DeSantis wants to take over

last_post.content:
An article about what's going on at the New College of Florida cites the following data: "a majority of US professors identify as far left or liberal— 60% in 2017, up from 41% in 1990"

Meanwhile there's abundant data re: the rise of the academic precariat (adjuncts & other short-term-contracted jobs, e.g. my own) — roughly contemporaneous with the above. Professors who have to constantly worry about having an income & healthcare. Just an observation..

link: https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2023-02-05/florida-liberal-arts-college-gov-ron-desantis-wants-to-take-over

title: dplyr 1.1.0: `pick()`, `reframe()`, and `arrange()`

last_post.content:
The final post for dplyr 1.1.0 is out! #rstats 🎉

Today, we'll look at two new verbs:
- `pick()` for column selection
- `reframe()` as a way to "do anything" to each group

We'll also look at performance and reproducibility improvements to `arrange()`!

https://www.tidyverse.org/blog/2023/02/dplyr-1-1-0-pick-reframe-arrange/

title: 02 | vectors

last_post.content:
for my last semester at ITP I'm taking @shiffman's Nature of Code! but as a personal challenge I'm trying to do it all in #webgl ✨

so as a webGL newbie I'm trying to seek advice for this week's assignment: I'm trying to recreate dry brush strokes w/ ~30 "dots" (transformed in vertex shader) per brush stroke but that doesn't feel optimal/performant? should I draw direct to fragment shader instead?

here's the @observablehq: https://observablehq.com/@sxywu/02-noc-vectors

title: What I Think About LeBron Breaking My NBA Scoring Record

last_post.content: https://kareem.substack.com/p/what-i-think-about-lebron-breaking This is so completely not my world that it's not funny - I vaguely recognize the name LeBron James and could barely even have said that of Kareem Abdul-Jabbar. That's on me - I'm exactly that cliched kind of professor. Even so, coming from a place of nearly complete ignorance about their sporting accomplishments, I'm still interested in good prose and thinking. And damn - Abdul-Jabbar can write.

title: Barbara Mikkelson, Author at Snopes.com

last_post.content:
So this is something cool: When I worked for Snopes, my former boss, David Mikkelson, took his ex-wife's byline off every single story and told everybody it was some sort of "WordPress migration error" (which was bullshit.) Now that he's been revealed as a serial plagiarist, Snopes appears to be trying to restore some balance to the universe by restoring Barbara's byline. I strongly approve:

https://www.snopes.com/author/barbara-mikkelson/

title: Italy’s Internet Outage a Perfect Storm

last_post.content:
The punchline is clear in @stucchimax 's analysis of Sunday's multi-hour Italian #Internet outage: lack of transit diversity, compounded by a deliberate lack of domestic #peering by Italy's incumbent telco.

Some national-scale Internet failures are 100% predictable and preventable.

Super-timely analysis by @internetsociety 👏

https://pulse.internetsociety.org/blog/italys-internet-outage-a-perfect-storm

title: Still sharing a Netflix account? That'll cost Canadians an extra $8 a month, starting now | CBC News

last_post.content:
I am sure Netflix has some chart somewhere that says this will make money number go up, but it's amazing that they're willing to totally torch user satisfaction like this and push people back toward pirating.

This is especially true given how good open-source software has gotten at automating piracy now 😬 https://www.cbc.ca/news/business/netflix-password-sharing-1.6741484

title: raport.valisluureamet.ee/2023/...

last_post.content: 2023 report by the Estonian Foreign Intelligence Agency. Probably one of the more substantive and widely-ranging English-language reports on Russia, its military objectives in #Ukraine, prospects in both physical and cyberspace, its economy and prospects, sanctions evasion, MFA interactions in Africa, foreign policy generally, and its current intelligence service priorities. Also has large focus on medium-term major risks to Estonia, other Baltic states, and #NATO itself https://raport.valisluureamet.ee/2023/assets/WEB_VLA_ENG-raport_2023.pdf

title: telemetry in the Go toolchain · Discussion #58409 · golang/go

last_post.content:
Doing tool telemetry in a respectful way, I like what Russ from the Go team is proposing here. We never put telemetry on Mono, as designing a respectful system like this is a project on its own.

I didn’t like the mandatory and over-the-top telemetry that was forced into .net core (it is the first thing I disable - and you should too):

https://github.com/golang/go/discussions/58409

The paper is free to read via this link: https://rdcu.be/c5brE

title: Solving a machine-learning mystery

last_post.content:
RT @AlphaSignalAI@twitter.com

Large Language Models are fascinating.

1. They can store and simulate other NNs inside their hidden layers and adapt to new tasks without new data.
📄https://news.mit.edu/2023/large-language-models-in-context-learning-0207

2. They can secretly perform gradient descent as Meta-Optimizers.
📄 https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.10559v2

*jaw drop*

🐦🔗: https://twitter.com/AlphaSignalAI/status/1623391318415122441

title: Want to Delete Your Twitter DMs? Good Luck With That

last_post.content:
I was interviewed by @mattburgess for Wired magazine about my failed attempts to get my direct messages removed from Twitter.

However, most important and substantial words here are said by @mikarv: "Big Tech companies are trying to position themselves so that they decide what people’s information rights are and what information they should provide to people."

"We don’t really know the extent of information that’s collected by these companies."
